1.text: I am the man who hath seen affliction By the rod of His wrath.

2.text: Me He hath led, and causeth to go in darkness, and without light.

3.text: Surely against me He turneth back, He turneth His hand all the day.

4.text: He hath worn out my flesh and my skin. He hath broken my bones.

5.text: He hath built up against me, And setteth round poverty and weariness.

6.text: In dark places He hath caused me to dwell, As the dead of old.

7.text: He hath hedged me about, and I go not out, He hath made heavy my fetter.

8.text: Also when I call and cry out, He hath shut out my prayer.

9.text: He hath hedged my ways with hewn work, My paths He hath made crooked.

10.text: A bear lying in wait He is to me, A lion in secret hiding-places.

11.text: My ways He is turning aside, and He pulleth me in pieces, He hath made me a desolation.

12.text: He hath trodden His bow, And setteth me up as a mark for an arrow.

13.text: He hath caused to enter into my reins The sons of His quiver.

14.text: I have been a derision to all my people, Their song all the day.

15.text: He hath filled me with bitter things, He hath filled me with wormwood.

16.text: And He breaketh with gravel my teeth, He hath covered me with ashes.

17.text: And Thou castest off from peace my soul, I have forgotten prosperity.

18.text: And I say, Perished hath my strength and my hope from Jehovah.

19.text: Remember my affliction and my mourning, Wormwood and gall!

20.text: Remember well, and bow down doth my soul in me.

21.text: This I turn to my heart—therefore I hope.

22.text: The kindnesses of Jehovah! For we have not been consumed, For not ended have His mercies.

23.text: New every morning, abundant is thy faithfulness.

24.text: My portion is Jehovah, hath my soul said, Therefore I hope for Him.

25.text: Good is Jehovah to those waiting for Him, To the soul that seeketh Him.

26.text: Good! when one doth stay and stand still For the salvation of Jehovah.

27.text: Good for a man that he beareth a yoke in his youth.

28.text: He sitteth alone, and is silent, For He hath laid it upon him.

29.text: He putteth in the dust his mouth, if so be there is hope.

30.text: He giveth to his smiter the cheek, He is filled with reproach.

31.text: For the Lord doth not cast off to the age.

32.text: For though He afflicted, yet He hath pitied, According to the abundance of His kindness.

33.text: For He hath not afflicted with His heart, Nor doth He grieve the sons of men.

34.text: To bruise under one’s feet any bound ones of earth,

35.text: To turn aside the judgment of a man, Over-against the face of the Most High,

36.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord hath not approved.

37.text: Who is this—he hath said, and it is, And the Lord hath not commanded it?

38.text: From the mouth of the Most High Go not forth the evils and the good.

39.text: What—sigh habitually doth a living man, A man for his sin?

40.text: We search our ways, and investigate, And turn back unto Jehovah.

41.text: We lift up our heart on the hands unto God in the heavens.

42.text: We—we have transgressed and rebelled, Thou—Thou hast not forgiven.

43.text: Thou hast covered Thyself with anger, And dost pursue us; Thou hast slain—Thou hast not pitied.

44.text: Thou hast covered Thyself with a cloud, So that prayer doth not pass through.

45.text: Offscouring and refuse Thou dost make us In the midst of the peoples.

46.text: Opened against us their mouth have all our enemies.

47.text: Fear and a snare hath been for us, Desolation and destruction.

48.text: Rivulets of water go down my eye, For the destruction of the daughter of my people.

49.text: Mine eye is poured out, And doth not cease without intermission,

50.text: Till Jehovah looketh and seeth from the heavens,

51.text: My eye affecteth my soul, Because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: Hunted me sore as a bird have my enemies without cause.

53.text: They have cut off in a pit my life, And they cast a stone against me.

54.text: Flowed have waters over my head, I have said, I have been cut off.

55.text: I called Thy name, O Jehovah, from the lower pit.

56.text: My voice Thou hast heard, Hide not Thine ear at my breathing—at my cry.

57.text: Thou hast drawn near in the day I call Thee, Thou hast said, Fear not.

58.text: Thou hast pleaded, O Lord, the pleadings of my soul, Thou hast redeemed my life.

59.text: Thou hast seen, O Jehovah, my overthrow, Judge Thou my cause.

60.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance, All their thoughts of me.

61.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Jehovah, All their thoughts against me,

62.text: The lips of my withstanders, Even their meditation against me all the day.

63.text: Their sitting down, and their rising up, Behold attentively, I am their song.

64.text: Thou returnest to them the deed, O Jehovah, According to the work of their hands.

65.text: Thou givest to them a covered heart, Thy curse to them.

66.text: Thou pursuest in anger, and destroyest them, From under the heavens of Jehovah!
